articles.author: Mohammed Salem
articles.description: Palestinian couple Mahmoud and Fatima Jarghoun sold their jewellery so they could perform the haj pilgrimage to Mecca - a journey they have been yearning to make for years. But with no way out of the Gaza Strip, their dream has been dashed.
articles.title: Gaza war shatters pilgrimage dream for Palestinian couple

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Angelo Amante
articles.description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's arch-conservative Brothers of Italy group won the most votes in the European parliamentary election over the weekend, results showed, boosting her standing both at home and abroad.
articles.title: Italy's PM Meloni comes out on top in EU vote, strengthening her hand

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Jan Strupczewski, Julia Payne
articles.description: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen began trying to piece together a coalition on Monday after the far right surged in a European Parliament election, spurring French President Emmanuel Macron to call a snap national vote.
articles.title: EU's von der Leyen seeks centrist allies after far-right election gains

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken visits Egypt and Israel on Monday hoping to deliver the ceasefire that President Joe Biden proposed last month, in an all-out push by Washington to secure an end to the Gaza war.
articles.title: Blinken in Middle East to push ceasefire while Israeli troops advance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Seoul was following through on a warning demanding that Pyongyang stop sending balloons carrying trash into the South.
articles.title: North Korea leader's sister warns of new response against South Korean loudspeakers, leaflets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's military said it damaged three Russian surface-to-air defence systems overnight in missile attacks on the Moscow-occupied Crimea peninsula.
articles.title: Ukraine says it hit Russian air defence systems in occupied Crimea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France began to gear up for elections on Monday, after President Emmanuel Macron called a shock snap legislative election following a bruising loss in the European Parliament vote to the far-right party of Marine Le Pen.
articles.title: France enters election mode after far-right win in European Parliament vote

articles.author: Belén Carreño, Charlie Devereux
articles.description: Spain's centrist parties contained a far-right surge in Sunday's European Parliament elections that is shaking governments in neighbouring countries, helping to bolster Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez standing as one of Europe centre-left's leading figures.
articles.title: Spain's centrists stem far-right surge in EU vote, bolstering Sanchez status

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan has arrested a Chinese man who sailed a speedboat into a harbour at the mouth of a river leading into Taipei for illegal entry, the Taiwanese coast guard said on Monday.
articles.title: Taiwan arrests Chinese man who took speedboat into Taipei harbour

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The economy, migration and international conflicts were the top concerns for voters in the European Union election, data from the bloc's biggest member countries suggested on Monday.
articles.title: Economy, migration, war top voters' concerns in EU election - survey
